entry.title: Drizzle
entry.content: ... that the vocals on "Drizzle" (record pictured), one of the earliest Chinese pop songs, were likened to "the cacophony produced by a hanged cat"?

entry.title: Mark Hearld
entry.content: ... that a profile of artist Mark Hearld said his "wrens and squirrels, field mice and owls" help a child care about the planet better than telling them it is burning?

entry.title: 4th and 26
entry.content: ... that the NFL listed the 4th and 26 game as one of the greatest in the first 100 years of its history?

entry.title: David Einhorn
entry.content: ... that the Yiddish poet David Einhorn levelled criticism at other Jewish writers in Berlin whom he accused of being "bourgeois intellectuals" and out-of-touch with their fellow migrants?

entry.title: Kokusai Ta-Go
entry.content: ... that the Kokusai Ta-Go aircraft was purposely designed for the kamikaze role?

entry.title: LGBTQ synagogues
entry.content: ... that LGBTQ synagogues helped shape the American Jewish response to AIDS in the 1980s, even as the disease killed many of their members?

entry.title: Ali-Hajji of Akusha
entry.content: ... that Ali-Hajji of Akusha supported the Bolsheviks because he believed that they would implement sharia?

entry.title: health of prisoners in Australia
entry.content: ... that the health of prisoners in Australia is impacted by their lack of access to Medicare, the country's otherwise-universal health care system?

entry.title: a new TV station in the state of Washington
entry.content: ... that during hearings for a new TV station in the state of Washington, an engineer collapsed on the witness stand, a radio station owner suffered food poisoning, and his rival's wife was hospitalized?
